intro: Styphelia exarata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of less than 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers during the winter months, which is unusual for many flowering plants. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round foliage. Styphelia exarata thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as pine forests.
